prompt: In a class, 30 like Math, 25 like Science, 10 like both. How many like only Math?
Out of 50 students, 20 play cricket, 15 play football, 5 play both. How many play at least one sport?
In survey: 40 like tea, 35 like coffee, 15 like both. How many like only coffee?
100 people surveyed: 60 read newspaper A, 50 read B, 30 read both. How many read neither?
45 students: 25 passed Math, 30 passed English, 15 passed both. How many passed only English?
In a group: 18 eat pizza, 12 eat burger, 6 eat both. How many eat at least one?
70 people: 40 have car, 30 have bike, 15 have both. How many have only car?
Class of 60: 35 like Hindi, 40 like English, 20 like both. How many like neither?
Out of 80: 50 have mobile, 45 have laptop, 25 have both. Total having at least one?
Survey: 28 like red, 22 like blue, 8 like both. How many like only red?
In office of 55: 30 know Hindi, 35 know English, 20 know both. How many know only Hindi?
120 students: 70 study Science, 80 study Arts, 40 study both. Students studying exactly one subject?
explanation: Only Science=30, Only Arts=40. Exactly one = 30+40=70.

prompt: Out of 90: 45 like A, 50 like B, 20 like both. How many like neither A nor B?
Group of 40: 22 play tennis, 18 play badminton, 8 play both. Only badminton players?
In survey of 65: 35 use Android, 40 use iOS, 15 use both. At least one type users?
75 employees: 40 know MS Word, 50 know Excel, 30 know both. Only Word users?
Class: 28 passed Test A, 32 passed Test B, 12 passed both. Failed both tests if total 50?
explanation: Passed at least one = 28+32-12=48. Failed both = 50-48=2.

prompt: Survey of 100: 55 like apples, 45 like oranges, 20 like both. Like only oranges?
Out of 85: 48 subscribe A, 52 subscribe B, 30 subscribe both. Subscribe exactly one?
explanation: Only A=18, Only B=22. Exactly one = 18+22=40.

prompt: In group of 60: 32 like swimming, 28 like cycling, 10 like both. Like neither?
110 people: 65 read Hindi news, 70 read English news, 40 read both. Read only Hindi?
Survey: 38 prefer tea, 42 prefer coffee, 18 prefer both. Total surveyed if 12 prefer neither?
Class of 45: 20 take Music, 25 take Art, 8 take both. Take only Art?
In company: 55 use Mac, 65 use Windows, 25 use both. Total employees if 10 use neither?
Out of 72: 42 have dog, 38 have cat, 18 have both. Have only dog?
95 students: 55 play indoor, 60 play outdoor, 35 play both. Play only outdoor?
Group: 30 like A, 40 like B, 50 like C, 10 like A and B, 15 like B and C, 12 like A and C, 5 like all. Like only A?
In survey of 150: 80 drink milk, 90 drink tea, 40 drink both. Drink neither?
48 members: 30 know swimming, 22 know diving, 12 know both. Know only swimming?
Out of 88: 50 passed Hindi, 55 passed Maths, 25 passed both. Passed at least one?
Survey: A=45, B=35, A and B=15. How many like A or B or both?
Class of 70: 40 took test A, 45 took test B, 25 took both. Took neither?
Out of 55: 28 use service A, 32 use service B, 12 use both. Use exactly one service?
explanation: Only A=16, Only B=20. Exactly one = 16+20=36.

prompt: Survey of 80: 45 like X, 50 like Y, 20 like both. Like only Y?
In group: 35 have trait A, 40 have trait B, 10 have both. Total if 5 have neither?
120 employees: 75 know skill A, 80 know skill B, 50 know both. Know only skill B?
Out of 65: 38 attend event A, 42 attend event B, 20 attend both. Attend neither?
Survey: 55 like category P, 45 like category Q, 25 like both. Like only P?
In a town of 500: 300 read paper A, 250 read paper B, 150 read both. Read at least one?
Out of 90: 52 have feature X, 48 have feature Y, 22 have both. Have only X?
Class: 44 passed exam 1, 38 passed exam 2, 18 passed both. If 10 failed both, total students?
In survey: 60 prefer A, 50 prefer B, 30 prefer both. Prefer exactly one?
explanation: Only A=30, Only B=20. Exactly one = 30+20=50.

prompt: Out of 85: 48 members of club A, 52 members of club B, 28 members of both. Of only B?
Group of 78: 45 play game X, 40 play game Y, 15 play both. Play neither?
Survey: A=62, B=48, both=25. How many like at least one?
In office of 96: 58 know English, 54 know French, 30 know both. Know neither?
Out of 68: 35 subscribe plan A, 42 subscribe plan B, 18 subscribe both. Subscribe only A?
Survey of 115: 70 use product X, 65 use product Y, 35 use both. Use at least one?
In class: 33 like subject A, 28 like subject B, 14 like both. Total if 8 like neither?
Out of 75: 42 have certification A, 48 have certification B, 22 have both. Have exactly one?
explanation: Only A=20, Only B=26. Exactly one = 20+26=46.
